description:
In the previous update we brought stories into the app. In this update we're refining that experience. Pre-loading now opens stories much faster and with the new default in-app browser you never need to leave breaking to read a story.

We're also introducing something we've wanted forever: the 'hot' badge. Harnessing the community of Breaking users, we are now able to highlight stories in your feeds that are popular with other users. If one of your stories has a little orange flame icon next to the title, it means that other Breaking users found this story interesting.

We're listening to feedback and constantly trying to improve your experience of reading the news. One big challenge with the widget has been how and when to properly handle loading of new stories without running out of (limited!) memory. In the last version we switched to background fetching and some people have experienced it as not always being 100% up to date. Unacceptable! In this version we've reworked it again to combine background fetching with a new and optimized direct load. It should ensure that news in the widget are always as recent as possible.

What's new in 1.5:
- Choose to open stories inside Breaking in the new custom in-app browser.
- New 'Hot' Badge appears on stories in your feeds that other Breaking users found interesting.
- Preloading stories increase the speed in which we are able to show a story.
- New reworked loading should improve freshness of widget stories.
- The entire application has been localized to German, Japanese and Chinese.
- Fixed a bug where sharing news to Facebook or Twitter didn't work when initiated from the widget.
- Fixed a bug where story extracts wasn't shown on the iPad
- Various bug fixes and improvements.

Breaking has, right from the start, been about making News that matters to you more accessible. Today we're introducing a major new section of the app that further helps that goal.

We're excited to show you the new Stories view! From the Stories tab inside the app, you can view all available stories from the feeds you have added.
You can open a story, dismiss it, share it or save it for later reading. In many ways the stories view inside the app is the older brother of the today widget, sharing many of the same functionalities but in more substantial way. Where the today widget excels at glancing latest news, the stories view let's you explore all recent entries.

We've also been hard at work fixing the most critical issues in Breaking. The Today view now more reliably loads and shows news. If you've often gotten the infamous "Unable to load" message, please take this update for a swing.

New in this update:
- We've introduced the Stories view in the application. From there you can access all available stories from the feeds you have added.
- The Today view has become much more reliable!
- The Recent view as well as the new Stories view shows images from stories.
- We've included a handful of new sound effects and you can turn those off in the settings.
- We've also added settings to hide extracts and images in stories.
- We've fixed a bug where the extract of stories would not be shown or include HTML tags.
- We've also squashed a few other bugs.

This update is all about exploration and refinement. We wanted to make it easier for you to find awesome teeds to follow in Breaking, therefore we've introduced the 'Popular tab'. From here you can view the most
popular feeds among fellow Breaking users and add them to your own with a single tap.

We've also redesigned both the DS app and the Apple Watch app and added a bunch of new smaller features.

Here's a list of some of the most exciting changes in this update:

- View the most popular feeds among fellow Breaking users in the new Popular tab in the app. From here, you can add the feeds with a single tap.
- Choose to open articles in Safari, Google Chrome or 1Password.
- Save articles to Safari Reading List for later reading.
- You can now dismiss stories directly from your Apple Watch.
- Read the entire story on your Apple Watch by opening the story and then force pressing it.
- Force touch on the list of stories on your Apple Watch to reload the list of stories.
- We gave both the IOS app and the Apple Watch app a makeover to make important features more visible and much cooled
- We added a better onboarding experience for new users.

New in this version:

- The stories in the Recent tab can now be long pressed to present the same interactions as in the today view. That is, you can share the stories to Facebook or Twitter. save the story to Instapaper or Pocket or open the
story in the default action sheet.
- The app remembers the stories saved to Instapaper or Pocket and now always displays the checkmark if a story has already been stored to a read later service.
- Adds a welcome screen, which will be displayed on first launch, making it easier for new users to get started with Breaking.
- Fixes an issue where stories would reappear if they were read and then dismissed.
- Various bug fixes

Breaking 1.2 is another huge update. First of all we're excited to inform you that Breaking is now available for the Apple Watch!

Straight from your wrist you can now view the most recent story in a glance or tap on it and view a full list of recent stories. Stories can be added to either Instapaper or Pocket with a single tap. Staying on top of news
that matter to you have never been easier

In this update we're also rolling out the number one requested feature: awesome support for read-later services. You can now sign into either Instapaper or Pocket from the in-app settings and add stories to those
services directly from the today view or from your Apple Watch. Trust us, it is seriously cool and your reading list will be filling up in no time.

We've also improved the overall stability of the widget and squashed a few bugs. continuing to refine the experience. If you like what we're doing then write us an App Store review and tell a friend. We read everything and it really means a lot.
This update is all about smashing bugs. We also made various improvements to the Danish translations

We're excited to show you the the next version of Breaking.

New in this update:

- You can swipe to dismiss a story in the widget. Dismissing a story will remove it from the widget and show you the next story.
- Press and hold on a story to share it on Twitter or Facebook or open it any other app that supports the native share extension, e.g. Instapaper.
- We are introducing Recent stories. From the Recent tab in the application, you can open and share the latest stories you have read or dismissed.
- We have added a setting to choose the amount of stories to display. On iPhone you can choose to show up to five stories and on iPad you can choose to show up to ten stories_
- We also added a setting to open stories in Readability, giving you a more pleasent reading experience.

We have also improved the general stability and reliability of the today widget and squashed a few bugs in the app.
